Open Project Database

Use the Open Project Database dialog box (File | Open Project Database) to locate a project database to add to the Project pane. Opening a project database displays all projects and versioned files contained in that project database.

Field Descriptions

Look in Select a valid drive or path. The contents of the drive or path you select appear in the contents list.

NOTE Select File Servers to view a list of project databases available on Version Manager file servers.
Contents List Double-click to select a directory that contains the project database. The list displays the directories in the drive or folder selected in the Look in field. Single-click to update the Folder name field to reflect the full path name of the project database location.
Opens the directory one level above the current level. This button is disabled if you are at the top level of a directory.
Creates a new folder in the currently selected directory. You may rename the new folder using in-place editing. The following characters are not allowed in new folder names: \ / : * ? " < > | .
Folder name Use the Look In and Contents list fields to select and display a folder and path to the directory where the project database is located, or enter a path and folder name. Folders containing project databases are shown as a folder with the Version Manager project database icon inside .
